docs.snippet: Nearly 540 tons of metals — mostly iron and aluminum — contaminated the Animas River over nine hours during a massive wastewater spill from an abandoned Colorado gold mine, the Environmental Protection Agency said Friday in a new repor...
docs.lead_paragraph: Nearly 540 tons of metals — mostly iron and aluminum — contaminated the Animas River over nine hours during a massive wastewater spill from an abandoned Colorado gold mine, the Environmental Protection Agency said Friday in a new report on the 2015 blowout that turned rivers in three states a sickly yellow.

headline.main: EPA: 540 Tons of Metals Entered River in Colo. Mine Spill
headline.print_headline: EPA: 540 Tons of Metals Entered River in Colo. Mine Spill
